elements.title: Cueva de las Manos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that of the hundreds of hands stenciled at Cueva de las Manos as artwork (pictured), very few are right hands?

elements.title: Susan Bernal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Colombian-born Susan Bernal is developing new cements that can reduce the substantial CO2 emissions currently caused by concrete?

elements.title: Columbus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Columbus was a disposable ship, built from large quantities of North American timber and intended to be sailed to London where she would be dismantled to avoid cargo import duties?

elements.title: deleted articles on Wikipedia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that deleted articles on Wikipedia may be "salted" so that they cannot be recreated?

elements.title: Cher Scarlett (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cher Scarlett is one of the leaders of #AppleToo, a workers' rights movement at Apple Inc.?

elements.title: arctic dandelion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that flowers of the arctic dandelion do not need to be pollinated in order to set seed?

elements.title: Hüseyin Er (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British Turk Hüseyin Er won world and European championships with the Turkey national deaf football team?

elements.title: a U.S. Supreme Court case (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a U.S. Supreme Court case had "odd bedfellows"?
